docs.snippet: The Philippine government lifted its five-year ban on the return of Imelda Marcos today and said the widow of the late President Ferdinand Marcos was free to come home from exile in the United States.    In announcing the decision, Franklin Drilon...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Philippine government lifted its five-year ban on the return of Imelda Marcos today and said the widow of the late President Ferdinand Marcos was free to come home from exile in the United States. In announcing the decision, Franklin Drilon, the presidential executive secretary, said the ban on the body of the late president, who died in September 1989 in Hawaii, would remain in force.

headline.main: Manila Lifts Ban on Mrs. Marcos

docs.snippet: MOSCOW, Feb. 13 (Reuters) -- Premier Nikita S. Khrushchev is keeping a sharp eye on Soviet clothing fashions as well as on weightier affairs of state. He said in a speech yesterday that it was high time some of the clothes worn by Russian men and ...
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Feb. 13 (Reuters) -- Premier Nikita S. Khrushchev is keeping a sharp eye on Soviet clothing fashions as well as on weightier affairs of state. He said in a speech yesterday that it was high time some of the clothes worn by Russian men and women should be "consigned to a museum."
docs.abstract: Premier Khrushchev scores styles, especially padded jackets; illus
